conclusion.title: Gist of Reflections and Vertical Stretches

paragraphs.p: In this section we study transformations that stretch a function or reflect the function across one of the axes.

Thinking once again of function notation as language, we know that the notation f(x) indicates an input called x and an output called f(x). Therefore, by replacing x with -x we are referring to the opposite of the input. That is, the function assumes the same output values but at the opposite input values.
Likewise, if we replace f(x) with -f(x), we are referring to the opposite of the output. The function has opposite results for the same input values.
In each case, -f(x) and f(-x) represent reflections:
